subject: Fashion
title: First Impression Bias
description: A quick win: understand First Impression Bias.

hook.text: It takes one-tenth of a second to form a first impression. Clothing is the biggest visual cue.

buildup.text: People in suits are rated more competent, even when their answers match those of casually dressed peers.

discovery.text: The bias runs deep: defendants who dress formally in courtrooms receive lighter sentences on average.

twist.text: Awareness doesn't help. Knowing about the bias doesn't stop your brain from making the snap judgment.

climax.text: We think we judge people on character. But our brains judge the outfit long before the person.

punchline.text: You're judged in a tenth of a second. Clothes speak first.

quiz.question: What happens when people are made aware of clothing-based first impression bias?
options: They completely overcome the bias and judge people more fairly
They overcompensate by favoring casually dressed individuals
